remarks: The subspace sum of a closed subspace and an atom is the same as their subspace join.  (Contributed by NM, 1-Oct-2014.)
statement:
dihjat2.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
dihjat2.i $e |- I = ( ( DIsoH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dihjat2.j $e |- .\/ = ( ( joinH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dihjat2.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dihjat2.p $e |- .(+) = ( LSSum ` U ) $.
dihjat2.a $e |- A = ( LSAtoms ` U ) $.
dihjat2.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
dihjat2.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. ran I ) $.
dihjat2.q $e |- ( ph -> Q e. A ) $.
dihjat2 $p |- ( ph -> ( X .\/ Q ) = ( X .(+) Q ) ) $.
